page.title: 06TYPES OF SHEEP AROUND HOWNAM
page.content: The main type of sheep that graze around Hownam in the Scottish Borders are the grey face,a cross between the Scottish black face ewe and the blue headed Leicester tup. These highly prolific ewes,crossed mainly with the Suffolk tup,produce large numbers of lambs,most of which are sold fat at local marts. There are North and South country cheviots too,which bred pure, produce ewe lambs,some to be retained as stock and the surplus sold to be crossed later with Border Leicester tups,producing the Scottish Half Bred, traditionally the finest of all low- land ewes.The male lambs are mostly sold at store and fat-stock marts,and a few of the best kept as tups to be sold for breeding or commercial use. Though unpopular with modern farmers, the meat and wool of North Country Cheviots is of the hughest quality.
